intro: Bridelia chineensis, commonly known as Chinese bridelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
